pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:0.5: 79. The training rule on obstructing a legal procedure
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were misbehaving, but when a legal procedure was being done against any one of them, they would object.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:1.3: On one occasion the Sangha had gathered on some business.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:1.4: The monks from the group of six were busy making robes and so they gave their consent to one among them.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:1.6: When the monks saw that only one monk from the group of six had come, they did a legal procedure against him.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:1.7: When he returned to the monks from the group of six,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:1.10: “It did a legal procedure against me.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:1.11: “We didn’t give our consent for that.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:1.13: If we had known that a procedure would be done against you, we wouldn’t have given our consent.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:1.14: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:1.15: “How could the monks from the group of six give their consent to legitimate legal procedures and then criticize them afterwards?” …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:1.16: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:1.19: “Foolish men, how could you do this?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:1.21: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:1.22.1: ‘If a monk gives his consent to legitimate legal procedures, and then criticizes them afterwards, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:2.1.4: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:2.1.6: a legal procedure consisting of getting permission, a legal procedure consisting of one motion, a legal procedure consisting of one motion and one announcement, a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements; done according to the Teaching, according to the Monastic Law, according to the Teacher’s instruction. This is called a “legitimate legal procedure”.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:2.1.7: If he gives his consent, and then criticizes the procedure, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:2.2.1: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, and he perceives it as such, and he criticizes it after giving his consent, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:2.2.2: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but he is unsure of it, and he criticizes it after giving his consent, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:2.2.3: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but he perceives it as illegitimate, and he criticizes it after giving his consent, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:2.2.4: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but he perceives it as legitimate, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:2.2.5: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:2.2.6: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, and he perceives it as such, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:2.3.2: if he criticizes it because he knows that the legal procedure was illegitimate, done by an incomplete assembly, or done against one who did not deserve it;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:2.3.4: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc79:2.3.5: The training rule on obstructing a legal procedure, the ninth, is finished.
